verses.esv: 13 Contribute to the needs of the saints and seek to show hospitality.
verses.kjv: 13 Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.
verses.niv: 13 Share with God's people who are in need. Practice hospitality.

verses.esv: 7 But you, take courage! Do not let your hands be weak, for your work shall be rewarded.”
verses.kjv: 7 Be ye strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak: for your work shall be rewarded.
verses.niv: 7 But as for you, be strong and do not give up, for your work will be rewarded."

verses.esv: 35 For I was hungry and you gave me food, I was thirsty and you gave me drink, I was a stranger and you welcomed me, 36 I was naked and you clothed me, I was sick and you visited me, I was in prison and you came to me.’ 37 Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you drink? 38 And when did we see you a stranger and welcome you, or naked and clothe you? 39 And when did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’ 40 And the King will answer them, ‘Truly, I say to you, as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
verses.kjv: 35 For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in: 36 Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me. 37 Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed thee? or thirsty, and gave thee drink? 38 When saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee? 39 Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee? 40 And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.
verses.niv: 35 For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in, 36 I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.' 37 "Then the righteous will answer him, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink? 38 When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you? 39 When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?' 40 "The King will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me.'

verses.esv: 2 and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal.
verses.kjv: 2 And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
verses.niv: 2 and he sent them out to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.

verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.

verses.esv: 7 casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.
verses.kjv: 7 Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.
verses.niv: 7 Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.

verses.esv: 12 Did I conceive all this people? Did I give them birth, that you should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries a nursing child,’ to the land that you swore to give their fathers?
verses.kjv: 12 Have I conceived all this people? have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father beareth the sucking child, unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers?
verses.niv: 12 Did I conceive all these people? Did I give them birth? Why do you tell me to carry them in my arms, as a nurse carries an infant, to the land you promised on oath to their forefathers?

verses.esv: 7 Then his sister said to Pharaoh’s daughter, “Shall I go and call you a nurse from the Hebrew women to nurse the child for you?”
verses.kjv: 7 Then said his sister to Pharaoh’s daughter, Shall I go and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
verses.niv: 7 Then his sister asked Pharaoh's daughter, "Shall I go and get one of the Hebrew women to nurse the baby for you?"

verses.esv: 17 But if anyone has the world’s goods and sees his brother in need, yet closes his heart against him, how does God’s love abide in him?
verses.kjv: 17 But whoso hath this world’s good, and seeth his brother have need, and shutteth up his bowels of compassion from him, how dwelleth the love of God in him?
verses.niv: 17 If anyone has material possessions and sees his brother in need but has no pity on him, how can the love of God be in him?

verses.esv: 15:1 We who are strong have an obligation to bear with the failings of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
verses.kjv: 1 We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
verses.niv: 1 We who are strong ought to bear with the failings of the weak and not to please ourselves.

verses.esv:
22   A joyful heart is good medicine,
    but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
verses.kjv: 22 A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
verses.niv: 22 A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

verses.esv: 16 I will seek the lost, and I will bring back the strayed, and I will bind up the injured, and I will strengthen the weak, and the fat and the strong I will destroy. I will feed them in justice.
verses.kjv: 16 I will seek that which was lost, and bring again that which was driven away, and will bind up that which was broken, and will strengthen that which was sick: but I will destroy the fat and the strong; I will feed them with judgment.
verses.niv: 16 I will search for the lost and bring back the strays. I will bind up the injured and strengthen the weak, but the sleek and the strong I will destroy. I will shepherd the flock with justice.

verses.kjv: 2 Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
verses.niv: 1 The elder, To my dear friend Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

verses.esv: 12 The LORD repay you for what you have done, and a full reward be given you by the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take refuge!”
verses.kjv: 12 The LORD recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the LORD God of Israel, under whose wings thou art come to trust.
verses.niv: 12 May the LORD repay you for what you have done. May you be richly rewarded by the LORD, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to take refuge."

verses.esv: 11:1 Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
verses.kjv: 1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
verses.niv: 1 Now faith is being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see.

verses.esv: 12 “This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.
verses.kjv: 12 This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.
verses.niv: 12 My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.

verses.esv:
31   but they who wait for the LORD shall renew their strength;
    they shall mount up with wings like eagles;
  they shall run and not be weary;
    they shall walk and not faint.
verses.kjv: 31 But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
verses.niv: 31 but those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.

verses.esv: 40 And the King will answer them, ‘Truly, I say to you, as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
verses.kjv: 40 And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.
verses.niv: 40 "The King will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers of mine, you did for me.'

verses.esv: 2 Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
verses.kjv: 2 Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.
verses.niv: 2 Carry each other's burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ.

verses.esv: 21 When I rose in the morning to nurse my child, behold, he was dead. But when I looked at him closely in the morning, behold, he was not the child that I had borne.”
verses.kjv: 21 And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead: but when I had considered it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, which I did bear.
verses.niv: 21 The next morning, I got up to nurse my son-and he was dead! But when I looked at him closely in the morning light, I saw that it wasn't the son I had borne."

verses.esv: 9 And Pharaoh’s daughter said to her, “Take this child away and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages.” So the woman took the child and nursed him.
verses.kjv: 9 And Pharaoh’s daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.
verses.niv: 9 Pharaoh's daughter said to her, "Take this baby and nurse him for me, and I will pay you." So the woman took the baby and nursed him.

verses.esv: 8 And Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and she was buried under an oak below Bethel. So he called its name Allon-bacuth.
verses.kjv: 8 But Deborah Rebekah’s nurse died, and she was buried beneath Bethel under an oak: and the name of it was called Allon-bachuth.
verses.niv: 8 Now Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died and was buried under the oak below Bethel. So it was named Allon Bacuth.

verses.esv: 10 So then, as we have opportunity, let us do good to everyone, and especially to those who are of the household of faith.
verses.kjv: 10 As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith.
verses.niv: 10 Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all people, especially to those who belong to the family of believers.

verses.esv: 11 For there will never cease to be poor in the land. Therefore I command you, ‘You shall open wide your hand to your brother, to the needy and to the poor, in your land.’
verses.kjv: 11 For the poor shall never cease out of the land: therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy brother, to thy poor, and to thy needy, in thy land.
verses.niv: 11 There will always be poor people in the land. Therefore I command you to be openhanded toward your brothers and toward the poor and needy in your land.

verses.esv: 7 But we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother taking care of her own children.
verses.kjv: 7 But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:
verses.niv: 7 As apostles of Christ we could have been a burden to you, but we were gentle among you, like a mother caring for her little children.
